alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Larimer, Gilpin, eastern Grand, northwestern Clear Creek and western Boulder Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 142 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Bear Lake to near Berthoud Pass, or along a line extending from 36 miles west of Fort Collins to 42 miles west of Denver. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Estes Park, Nederland, Fraser, Bear Lake, Winter Park, Central City, Grand Lake, Jamestown, Ward, Black Hawk, Raymond, Berthoud Pass, Brainard Lake, Tolland, Gold Hill, Tabernash, Meeker Park, Rollins Pass, Eldora and Rollinsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
